meanings.definition: Not able to be appeased or satisfied.
meanings.sent1: The toddler's inappeasable crying kept the parents awake all night.
meanings.sent2: Her inappeasable hunger led her to finish the entire pizza by herself.
meanings.sent3: The cat's inappeasable demand for treats made the owner laugh.
meanings.sent4: His inappeasable desire for success burned like a relentless fire within him.
meanings.sent5: The student's inappeasable curiosity drove her to ask endless questions in class.

meanings.sent1: The inappeasable ghost haunted the old mansion, scaring away all visitors.
meanings.sent2: Her inappeasable anger towards her ex-boyfriend made it hard for her to move on.
meanings.sent3: The inappeasable cat refused to eat any food that wasn't fresh out of the can.
meanings.sent4: The inappeasable storm raged on, showing no signs of calming down.
meanings.sent5: His inappeasable need for adventure led him to travel to far-off lands in search of excitement.
